Development Tools

Why Code Pen is awesome!

04/05/2014 Chris Lannister 1 Comment

I recently discovered Code Pen through CSS Tricks and I wish I had discovered it earlier, especially during my Web Design course at university as it’s perfect for quick experimentation!

Embedding

See the Pen Fluid?? by Chris Lannister (@ChrisLannister) on CodePen.

If you’re a blogger or run your own website then this feature is truly awesome, I intend to use it for a few tutorials in the future and the styling is great. Edit feature is a great way for end users to play with your code and really re-enforces the learning experience.

Markup & Extension Support

Full Page View

Full page view is a great way of showing clients what your currently working on without bothering them with any code. It’s also another way to display any work you want in your portfolio.

Live View (Real Time Updating)

By far Code Pen’s best feature is the automatic refreshing of pages while coding which lets you see the instant effect of anything you change. Many benefits include cross browser testing & multiple device testing. Ever struggled explaining to a client what something would look like or function? Send your client the URL and they’ll be able to see your changes in real time. I real game changer to finding a solution for them rapidly.

Inspiration / Feed Back

Code Pen is a social place don’t you know! Feed has a combination of beautiful and excellent snippets of code which are sure to inspire you. Seeing cleaver people’s clean code has defiantly inspired me to clean Scss and Haml! This truly opens your eyes to the potential awesomeness you can create. The search and tagging features also round round this tool off. You also have the ability to comment on other people’s “pens” and like them. The site is full of professionals and expert hobbyist willing to help you improve or give good feedback. I also recommend checking out the forums as well.

Support

I have first hand experience of the support you’ll receive with Code Pen. I submitted a ticket to inform the guys that the refresh live view wasn’t working. I had to manually refresh the page, which isn’t the end of the world but still one of Code Pen’s best features. I received a reply within 30 mins very apologetically explaining that the server that handles the live view feature was down and it would be back online shortly.

They also happened to refund me a months subscription cost, explaining that customer retention and keeping us happy was very important to them. Thanks guys! Anyway, I’m not saying that will happen in your case but thought it was something I needed to shout about. Here’s a link to the screen shot.
